channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road works, 14th November
item.description:
These road works have been on this bridge on and off for the past 3 years and I’m just wondering what’s happening

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Pothole outside driveway on road, 14th November
item.description:
On road outside number 24 Withyfield Road. It had been getting bigger each month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withyfield Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please resurface the road, 14th November
item.description:
The stretch of road is absolutely dreadful, it’s single lane so can’t be avoided! Every single winter multiple people down the lane get flat tyres when hitting the potholes. The weather makes them so bad. They get filled in after I report them, then the following year the tarmac comes back up. The road is terribly cracked. Lorries drive down the road as well as cars. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE, can we have the stretch resurfaced rather than just multiple pot holes filled in, will be hugely appreciated!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain cover has sunk several inches, 14th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 14th November
item.description:
email rec 13/11/2023 I was walking down Bethesda Street (GL50 2AY) in Cheltenham yesterday, in the dark, because both street lamps (near the corner with Commercial Street) were not working. I hope this will be remedied soon.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nasty pothole, 14th November
item.description:
Pothole in Brockhampton Lane just past the 30 mile speed limit signs as you enter the village.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooded pavement after rain and a constant sea of mud which is dangerous for pedestrians, 14th November
item.description:
Pavement outside The Coach House, 1A Queens Road, Cheltenham and outside Little Trees Day Nursery, Queens Road, The problem has been reported to Cheltenham 5 or 6 times this year. My husband and I shovelled away all the mud in June but it soon returned and is getting worse with dead leaves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow boxes needed on Road junction, 14th November
item.description:
Shurdington Road needs yellow boxes on the junction with Woodlands Road. At busy times, there is queuing traffic on Shurdington Road going towards the Bath Road blocking the junction, stopping any traffic from Woodlands Road to turn right on to Shurdington Road to go towards Brockworth. A yellow box on the junction would make it easy and reduce queuing time for the vehicles on Woodlands Road to turn right.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: A pothole on the speed bump, 14th November
item.description:
On the speed bump on Moorend Park Road, just after Pickering Road travelling towards Shurdington Road. Being on a speed bump makes it very harsh on the vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Moorend Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris the whole stretch of the lane including flint/screws, 14th November
item.description:
Potholes and subsided road the whole distance of the lane to Claydon, this has been there for months. More and more debris on road, last Thursday I got screws in a tyre, today a big chunk of flint from the last corner before Claydon equestrian. Please could it be road swept? Hasn’t been done in the year we have been there. I am now over £160 out of pocket.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 14th November
item.description:
Damaged National speed limit and 50mph sign as per the pictures Needs removal and reinstatement.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe subsidence in pavement adjacent to red bin on Bird Road by Hathorn Rd junction, 14th November
item.description:
There is significant trip hazard subsidence of about 150mm deep over an approx 4 metre length.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bird Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Cycleway from Hucclecote Road to James Way - street cleaning required, 14th November
item.description:
The cycle way at this location requires street cleaning as there is a high film of detritus leaf, mould and other accumulations, meaning that it needs to be cleaned both for safety and also for amenity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
